content:
MY heart, when first the blackbird sings,
My heart drinks in the song:
Cool pleasure fills my bosom through
And spreads each nerve along.

My bosom eddies quietly,
My heart is stirred and cool
As when a wind-moved briar sweeps
A stone into a pool

But unto thee, when thee I meet,
My pulses thicken fast,
As when the maddened lake grows black
And ruffles in the blast.
cleaned: my heart when first the blackbird sings my heart drinks the song cool pleasure fills my bosom and spreads each nerve along my bosom eddies quietly my heart stirred and cool as when a wind moved briar sweeps a stone a pool but unto thee when thee i meet my pulses thicken fast as when the maddened lake grows black and ruffles the blast
